definition: intangible changes/unnoticed transformation/changes behind the scenes
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove

sentences.english: As an emotional education, aesthetic education exerts an imperceptible influence on people's psychological mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 美育是情感教育，在潜移默化中影响人的心理机制。

sentences.english: It is not only can change your mood, will also exerts a change your life.
sentences.chinese: 它不仅能改变你的心情，也会潜移默化改变你的生活。

sentences.english: His wife has had a civilizing influence on him.
sentences.chinese: 他妻子对改进他言谈举止有潜移默化的影响。

sentences.english: The British Empire became a world empire in a total absent-mindedness.
sentences.chinese: 英国就是潜移默化地成为日不落帝国的。

sentences.english: Mayde this is what call influence imperceptibly.
sentences.chinese: 也许这是潜移默化的缘故吧。

sentences.english: His wife has had a civilizing influence on him.
sentences.chinese: 他妻子对改进他举止言谈有潜移默化的影响。

sentences.english: And it has also, subliminally, affected research.
sentences.chinese: 同时，还潜移默化地影响着各种研究。

sentences.english: Kalish says that Sellars' direction is subtle.
sentences.chinese: 卡利什说，塞拉斯“的方向是潜移默化的。

sentences.english: Western culture penetratrates ours every fields gradualy.
sentences.chinese: 西方文化潜移默化的渗入了每一个领域。

definition: habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature/same as 習慣成自然|习惯成自然
year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
happen unexpectedly/turn out contrary to one's expectations
to exert a gradual influence/to nurture/a corrupting influence
to accumulate over a long period of time
to lurk under water/to immerse oneself in (study etc)/to lie low/to keep a low profile/quiet/reserved/self-possessed
to concentrate/to think what you're doing
